intro: Cynanchum micranthum, commonly known as small-flowered milkvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae, which includes many milkweed species, and is characterized by its slender stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant produces a milky sap, which is typical of the genus Cynanchum, and it often grows in rocky or sandy soils. It is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a hardy species in harsh environments. Its ecological role includes providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a food source for certain herbivores.
